Abstract: The characterization of molecular structure and function of food proteins is crucial for advancing food science and technology. This study explores bioinformatic approaches, integrating protein modeling and computational biology, to elucidate the structural and functional properties of food proteins. By leveraging advanced data science techniques, we aim to enhance the understanding of protein functionality, which is pivotal for improving food quality and safety. The research employs state-of-the-art materials characterization tools to validate computational predictions, ensuring accuracy and reliability. Our findings demonstrate the potential of bioinformatics in predicting protein behavior, offering insights into their role in food systems. This interdisciplinary approach not only accelerates the discovery of novel protein functionalities but also supports the development of innovative food products with enhanced nutritional and sensory attributes.
